h3. Issue Summary

When you delete a version of an attachment attached to a page, any labels added to the page will be automatically removed.

(i) This only happens when an attachment has multiple versions and you remove one of them, leaving at least one version of the attachment still attached to the page.

If you remove an attachment with only 1 version, the bug doesn't occur.

 # Create a new page.
 # Add an attachment to the page.

 # Navigate to {{...}} > {{Attachments}} and add a 2nd version of the same attachment.
 # Remove any 1 of the 2 attachment versions.
 # Go back to the page.

The labels should still be intact on the page.
h3. Actual Results

All labels for that page are missing.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.

We suggest sticking with our latest Long Term Support (LTS) Release - Confluence 7.4.4, which is not affected by this bug.
fields.summary: Deleting an attachment version causes all labels to be removed from the page

h3. Issue Summary

Team Calendars attempts to perform a search for subcalendars that a user is entitled to see when attempting to add a calendar using the "Team Calendars" macro in Confluence. By normal behavior, this returns 10 most relevant results. However, if more results are to be generated either through changing search parameters or it uses a common search term, the sorting in the search field results will break.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Team calendar (any version of the plugin is fine)
# Create 11 calendars with similar names (see screenshot)
# Go into a page editor, and add the "Team Calendars macro"
# Attempt to add the calendars by name, in any order

h3. Expected Results

Calendars will sort alphanumerically (sometimes the numerical sorting is weird due to how ordinals are treated):

!image-2020-08-27-19-11-35-319.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Calendars will have random sort results after a content reindex:

!image-2020-08-27-19-15-43-922.png|thumbnail! 

Since these results are then added to an existing set, the previous sort order will likely be lost and the order becomes random as a fallback.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

- That said, you can just change all your calendars to have fully distinct names and codes so they are more readily searchable. Using generic calendar names could cause you to run into this situation.
fields.summary: Team Calendars sort behavior is broken

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Customers are reporting issues while trying to import an XML Site Backup back into a Confluence Vanilla instance (same version for instance *LTS 7.4.3* ). This should not happen:
 * the end-user experience can be improved by adding upfront checks directly in Confluence XML Backup code.
 * the end-user experience is currently impacted by such failure

h3. Suggested Solution

The Confluence site XML backup and restore processes should have a consistent level of data integrity checking so that Confluence administrators and end-users can be confident to restore their Backup successfully. This can be improved by:
 -  Either Adding data integrity checking to the backup process so backups fail with a warning about data integrity issues 
 -  Or Remove data integrity checking in {{user_mapping}} from the restore process - even with duplicate user mappings Confluence ran fine

h3. Why This Is Important

Having a look at these 2 Knowledge-Based articles:
 * *[Restore of a site XML backup fails due to duplicate entry '' for key 'unq_lwr_username' error|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/restore-of-a-site-xml-backup-fails-due-to-duplicate-entry-for-key-unq_lwr_username-error-998896818.html]*
 * *[Confluence site XML import fails with "duplicate key" error|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/confluence-site-xml-import-fails-with-duplicate-key-error-438993638.html]*
And the number of support tickets that have been resolved thanks to them can give you an idea of how this had (and keep) affect the Confluence end-users experience in recent history.

h3. Workaround
 * Follow *[Confluence site XML import fails with "duplicate key" error|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/confluence-site-xml-import-fails-with-duplicate-key-error-438993638.html]* or *[Restore of a site XML backup fails due to duplicate entry '' for key 'unq_lwr_username' error|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/restore-of-a-site-xml-backup-fails-due-to-duplicate-entry-for-key-unq_lwr_username-error-998896818.html]* until complete resolution of errors
fields.summary: Add Data Integrity checks and Improve Confluence XML Backup Experience

 * Formatting macros (i.e., Section, Panel, Column, Column, Expand,...)
 * Other macros (i.e., Multiexcerpt, Excerpt, Note, Info,...)

and you scroll further down on the page such that you can no longer see the macros label on the top left of the light gray boxes/sections denoting the specific macro, it becomes very difficult to tell which macro border is which.  You often don't realize that you've moved a group of text into the wrong box until you've saved a page, or visit another page (in the case of Excerpt).

For edit view, it would be ideal to differentiate the macro boxes somehow.  Some options include:
 # Currently the macro boxes are only labeled at the top left corner.  Please also include the same macro label, such as "Panel" or "Expand" or "Section" also at the bottom left of the macro box/section.
 # Another approach, which might be more difficult, would be to color the macro boxes (or use different formatting like dotted line).

 

Thank you.

This would also facilitate my tracking of how many Shares I send out per Space (currently I have to remember which pages are from specific Spaces, if I want to track my frequency via email).  Thank you.

 

Example, Training (page), The Stacks (space):

Current email subject *"[confluence] Chi,Candace shared "Training" with you"* - you cannot tell which Space this is from

Suggested change options:
 # *"[confluence] Chi, Candace shared "Training" from {color:#00875a}"The Stacks"{color} with you"*
 # *"[confluence] Chi, Candace shared "{color:#00875a}The Stacks:{color} Training" with you"***
 # (less ideal), Keep the current email subject with the Space name auto generated at the top of the text in the email message

h3. Environment
Confluence 7.5, 7.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an excel file to a page (eg. Excel test)
# Add excel macro and select the excel file
# Save and Publish the page
# Confirm that the Edit button can be seen for this attachment (screenshot: excelTest.png)
# Create a new page (eg. Include Excel test)
# Add the excel macro. Edit and under _Page Name_, type "Excel test"
# Check that the excel file is selected under the _File Name_
# Save and publish this page
# Notice that the Edit button for this attachment is missing (screenshot: includeExcelTest.png)

h3. Expected Results
Edit button should be visible for attachments in all pages where the office excel macro is used

h3. Actual Results
Only the original page where the attachment is present displays the Edit button. Other excel macros referencing this original page do not show the Edit button

h3. Workaround
This behavior is not replicable when using the [Office Connector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/enable-edit-in-office-as-a-dark-feature-in-confluence-978217013.html]

h3. Problem Definition

Sometimes a System App, or a module of a System App, might be disabled while Confluence is running or during startup. This could happen by a bug on Confluence or modified directly from the database.
 A Confluence administrator isn't able to enable this App/Module from the Universal Plugin Manager UI, requiring some downtime to restart the application when the problem is identified.

Note that this enhancement is not targeted on being able to disable these Apps/modules, but solely on the ability to *enable* them.
h3. Suggested Solution

When a System App (or module of a system app) is disabled, give the Confluence Administrator the ability to enable it from the UPM UI.
h3. Workarounds
h4. Use UPM REST API
Call UPM REST API to change the status of a given plugin or a single module
* [UPM REST API|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/UPM/pages/6094960/UPM+REST+API]

h4. Directly updating the database
Enable the App or the module via data manipulation on the database.
Refer to the following KB articles on how to accomplish it:
 * [How to Manually Change a Plugin Back to Default State Through the Database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-manually-change-a-plugin-back-to-default-state-through-the-database-592609333.html]
 * [How to reset all Confluence plugins back to their default state through the database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-reset-all-confluence-plugins-back-to-their-default-state-through-the-database-859509873.html]
 * [How Do I find enabled and disabled plugins in the database?|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/how-do-i-find-enabled-and-disabled-plugins-in-the-database/]
fields.summary: As a Confluence Administrator I should be able to enable a System App (or a module) from the UPM UI if it is currently disabled

h3. Problem

Confluence is configured to run with *-Dupm.pac.disable=true* as per the [Recognized System Properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/recognized-system-properties-190430.html]
{quote}
*upm.pac.disable*
|Universal Plugin Manager 1.5|When this property is set to true, then UPM will not try to access the [The Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/]. This is useful for application servers that do not have access to the Internet. See the [UPM documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/upm/problems-connecting-to-the-atlassian-marketplace-273875718.html].| {quote}

But this setting can be overwritten through the Confluence User Interface by access to the UPM Settings and Confluence will connect to the MarketPlace.

h3. Environment
Reproduced in Confluence version *7.4.x* and *7.6.x* and/or using UPM version *4.0.17*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Configure the Confluence JVM to run with *-Dupm.pac.disable=true*
** This will disable the *Connect to the Atlassian Marketplace* checkbox in the UPM Settings
* Tick back the *Connect to the Atlassian Marketplace* checkbox. 

h3. Expected Results
Confluence should not be able to call the Marketplace when *-Dupm.pac.disable=true* is set, regardless of UI settings. It should be a hard stop for all calls.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence is able to call the MarketPlace even when *-Dupm.pac.disable=true* is set, by tweaking the UI.

h3. Workaround
Keep the UI UPM setting *Connect to the Atlassian Marketplace* disabled at all time

h3. Notes
Recording attached with how the issue was reproduced locally
fields.summary: -Dupm.pac.disable=true JVM parameter does not prevent Marketplace connectivity in Confluence

{quote}Anonymous Access - this is where you grant permissions to users who are not logged in (essentially making the space public). *Note: allowing anonymous access in a space will allow all logged in users to see that space, even if your site is not Public.*
{quote}
In regards to the note (_allowing anonymous access in a space will allow all logged in users to see that space, even if your site is not Public_) it would be ideal that this point is visible on the space permissions page inside Confluence.

h3. Issue Summary
Oracle provides a feature called Native Network Encryption: [ORACLE\-BASE \- Native Network Encryption for Database Connections|https://oracle-base.com/articles/misc/native-network-encryption-for-database-connections] This feature was previously part of the Advanced Security Option license, and provides connection encryption without requiring client side configuration. 

When this feature is enabled, it adds 350ms+ to the time required to establish a database connection. This alone will cause noteworthy performance degradation, but when combined with the default database connection pool manager in Confluence, c3p0, it can cause intermittent outages and extreme performance degradation.

Oracle have stated that this latency is working as intended: [Slow Connection Using 12c Client When Network Encryption Is Enabled|https://support.oracle.com/knowledge/Oracle Database Products/2247689_1.html]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install any version of Confluence
# Install Oracle DB 11g or later with Native Network Encryption enabled
# Introduce load to the system
# Monitor Confluence for delayed or timeout responses

h3. Expected Results
Confluence should work as per normal.

h3. Actual Results
There is a prolonged delay in establishing database connections that causes c3p0 to get stuck in a loop of attempting to obtain additional database connections. As obtaining these database connections is slow, this will take longer than normal.

Confluence will remain unresponsive until it reaches the c3p0 maximum pool size for the node.

This issue will not be visible in the logs by default, but the following KB provides additional details on how to diagnose this issue: [Confluence Unresponsive Due to High Database Connection Latency|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/confluence-unresponsive-due-to-high-database-connection-latency-983794798.html]

h3. Workaround

A workaround is detailed on this KB: [Confluence Unresponsive Due to High Database Connection Latency|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/confluence-unresponsive-due-to-high-database-connection-latency-983794798.html]

However, it may be preferably to implement SSL to the database with proper certificate exchange, or disable Native Network Encryption entirely.
fields.summary: Running Confluence with Oracle Database Native Network Encryption Degrades Performance or Causes Outages

h3. Problem
Office Excel (view-xls) macro does not load and its corresponding thread gets stuck if the file contains formulas. Example:
{code}
=COUNTIF(Section,"Person4")+H1
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Attach the file  [^Test.xls]  to a page
# Add the *Office Excel* macro and select that file
# Save the page

The page and the macro render as expected.

h3. Actual Results

The page does not load anymore and the thread gets stuck infinitely. Only restarting the application will clear up that thread.

h3. Workaround

The file  [^Test-noformulas.xls]  is the same but the "COUNTIF" formulas were removed. The bug cannot be reproduced with that file. So, the options are:

# Edit the file and remove those formulas
# Or, use the File Preview macro instead of the Office Excel one

h3. Notes
Example of hanging thread:
{code}
at com.aspose.cells.zaaj.c
at com.aspose.cells.Workbook.calculateFormula
{code}

This can result in full unresponsiveness of the instance if the page is visited the same number of times that is defined in maxThreads (48 by default) since they all will get stuck in this operation. Only restarting will clear them up.

It also affects Data Center because the Office Excel macro is not covered by the file conversion sandboxing due to this bug:

* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-59425

h3. Problem Definition

As a Confluence administrator, I'd like to have an option to see the status of index replication between Confluence nodes.

h3. Suggested Solution

In Jira, there is the option to [check the status of the index|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.4.2/#api/2/index/summary-getIndexSummary] by using the {{/rest/api/2/index/summary/}} API call for each node and then compare the results.

It would be helpful to have a similar option in Confluence.

h3. Why this is important

Currently, there is no way for administrators to determine that the index across the nodes is staying in sync.

Confluence administrator may rely on a manual validation as described in [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-manually-rebuild-content-index-from-scratch-on-confluence-data-center-with-downtime-1019380452.html#HowtomanuallyrebuildcontentindexfromscratchonConfluenceDataCenterwithdowntime-Confirmingcontentindexisworkingonallnodes].

h3. Problem

There is no notification that using the same Consumer Key with multiple application links won't work.  
h3. Suggested Solution

_Add a notification or block users from using a Consume key that is already in use with another application link._ 
h3. Why This Is Important

_When users aren't aware that this is the case, they might create multiple application links for different purposes, using the same consumer key. This results in user frustration and confusion as to why it's not working as expected._ 
h3. Workaround
{quote}_"....It is expected that "Consumer Key"s will be unique across Application Links. This is because a "Consumer Key" uniquely identifies each "client" to Jira in much the same way that a "username" might be uniquely associated with a user. If they are duplicated/reused then multiple clients are saying that they are the same client and that is what leads to the behaviour observed when updating the Application Links."_

_-_Matthew 𝓭𝓻𝓴𝓷𝓸 Knox (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-74475)
{quote}
fields.summary: No notification regarding Application Link With Same Consumer Keys
